PAGE_001.title: The Chinese Mitten Crab
PAGE_001.text: The Chinese Mitten Crab is a predatory crab known for its hairy claws and its invasive intent. It lives in fresh waters.

PAGE_002.title: Taxonomy
PAGE_002.text: A decapod crustacean from the family Varunidae, adapted to both freshwater and saltwater environments.

PAGE_003.title: Lifecycle
PAGE_003.text: The Chinese Mitten Crab is catadromous species, the adults migrate to the ocean to spawn, larvae grow in saltwater, and juveniles travel far upstream into freshwater before returning to the sea to reproduce.

PAGE_004.title: Invasive Traits
PAGE_004.text: Highly mobile, climbs surfaces, burrows into banks, tolerates many environments, and females can carry up to one million eggs.

PAGE_005.title: Ecological Impact
PAGE_005.text: Competes with native species, eats fish eggs and plants, and damages habitats through burrowing, altering entire river systems.

PAGE_006.title: Human Concern
PAGE_006.text: May carry lung parasites if eaten raw. Large migrations can cause road blockages, drain clogs, and urban disturbances.
